280 integer :: grid_type = 0 !< -1: read from file; 0: ED Gnomonic

289 ! Momentum (or KE) options:
290 integer :: hord_mt = 9 !< Horizontal advection scheme for momentum fluxes. A
291 !< complete list of kord options is given in the
292 !< corresponding table in Appendix A of the
293 !< FV3 technical document. The default value is 9, which
294 !< uses the third-order piecewise-parabolic method with the
295 !< monotonicity constraint of Huynh, which is less diffusive
296 !< than other constraints. For hydrostatic simulation, 8
297 !< (the L04 monotonicity constraint) is recommended; for
298 !< nonhydrostatic simulation, the completely unlimited ("linear"
299 !< or non-monotone) PPM scheme is recommended. If no monotonicity
300 !< constraint is applied, enabling the flux damping
301 !< (do_vort_damp = .true.) is highly recommended to control grid-scale
302 !< noise. It is also recommended that hord_mt, hord_vt, hord_tm, and
303 !< hord_dp use the same value, to ensure consistent transport of all
304 !< dynamical fields, unless a positivity constraint on mass advection
305 !< (hord_dp) is desired.
306
307 integer :: kord_mt = 8 !< Vertical remapping scheme for the winds. 8 by default; 9 is recommended as
308 !< the safest option, although 10, and 11 can also be useful. See
309 !< corresponding table in Appendix A of the FV3
310 !< technical document for a complete list of kord options.
311
312 integer :: kord_wz = 8 !< Vertical remapping scheme for vertical velocity in nonhydrostatic simulations.
313 !< 8 by default; 9 recommended. It is also recommended to use the same value
314 !< for 'kord_wz' as for 'kord_mt'.
315
316 !> Vorticity & w transport options:
317 integer :: hord_vt = 9 !< Horizontal advection scheme for absolute vorticity and for
318 !< vertical velocity in nonhydrostatic simulations. 9 by default.
319
320
321 ! Heat & air mass (delp) transport options:
322 integer :: hord_tm = 9 !< Horizontal advection scheme for potential temperature and
323 !< layer thickness in nonhydrostatic simulations. 9 by default.
324
325 integer :: hord_dp = 9 !< Horizontal advection scheme for mass. A positivity
326 !< constraint may be warranted for hord_dp but not strictly
327 !< necessary. 9 by default.
328
329 integer :: kord_tm = -8 !< Vertical remapping scheme for temperature. If positive
330 !< (not recommended), then vertical remapping is performed on
331 !< total energy instead of temperature (see 'remap_t').
332 !< The default value is -8.
333 !> Tracer transport options:
334 integer :: hord_tr = 12 !< Horizontal advection scheme for tracers. The default is 12.
335 !< This value can differ from the other hord options since
336 !< tracers are subcycled (if inline_q == .false.) and require
337 !< positive-definite advection to control the appearance of
338 !< non-physical negative masses. 8 (fastest) or 10 (least diffusive)
339 !< are typically recommended.
340
341 integer :: kord_tr = 8 !< The vertical remapping scheme for tracers. The default is 8.
342 !< 9 or 11 recommended. It is often recommended to use the same
343 !< value for 'kord_tr' as for 'kord_tm'.
344
345 real :: scale_z = 0. !< diff_z = scale_z**2 * 0.25
346 real :: w_max = 75. !< max w (m/s) threshold for hydostatiic adjustment
347 real :: z_min = 0.05 !< min ratio of dz_nonhydrostatic/dz_hydrostatic
348 real :: lim_fac = 1.0 !< linear scheme limiting factor, 1: hord = 5, 3: hord = 6
349
350 integer :: nord = 1 !< Order of divergence damping: 0 for second-order; 1 for fourth-order
351 !< (default); 2 for sixth-order; 3 for eighth-order. Sixth-order may
352 !< yield a better solution for low resolutions (one degree or coarser)
353 !< by virtue of it being more scale-selective and will not damp moderately
354 !< well-resolved disturbances as much as does lower-order damping.
355
356 integer :: nord_tr = 0 !< Order of tracer damping; values mean the same as for 'nord'.
357 !< The default value is 0.
358
359 real :: dddmp = 0.0 !< Dimensionless coefficient for the second-order Smagorinsky-type
360 !< divergence damping. The default is value is 0.0. 0.2
361 !< (the Smagorinsky constant) is recommended if ICs are noisy.
362
363 real :: d2_bg = 0.0 !< Coefficient for background second-order divergence damping.
364 !< This option remains active even if nord is nonzero. The default
365 !< value is 0.0. The proper range is 0 to 0.02.
366
367 real :: d4_bg = 0.16 !< Dimensionless coefficient for background higher-order divergence damping.
368 !< 0.0 by default. If no second-order divergence damping is used, then values
369 !< between 0.1 and 0.16 are recommended. Requires 'nord' > 0. Note that the
370 !< scaling for 'd4_bg' differs from that of 'd2_bg'; 'nord' >= 1 and
371 !< 'd4_bg' = 0.16 will be less diffusive than 'nord' = 0 and 'd2_bg' = 0.02.
372
373 real :: vtdm4 = 0.0 !< Coefficient for background other-variable damping. The value of 'vtdm4'
374 !< should be less than that of 'd4_bg'. A good first guess for 'vtdm4' is
375 !< about one-third the value of d4_bg. Requires 'do_vort_damp'
376 !< to be .true. Disabled for values less than 1.e-3. Other-
377 !< variable damping should not be used if a monotonic horizontal advection
378 !< scheme is used. The default value is 0.0.
379
380 real :: trdm2 = 0.0 !< Coefficient for del-2 tracer damping
381 real :: d2_bg_k1 = 4. !< Strength of second-order diffusion in the top sponge layer.
382 !< Value must be specified. This value, and d2_bg_k2, will be changed
383 !< appropriately in the model (depending on the height of model
384 !< top), so the actual damping may be very reduced. See
385 !< atmos_cubed_sphere/model/dyncore.F90 for details. Recommended
386 !< range is 0. to 0.2. Note that since diffusion is converted to
387 !< heat if d_con > 0 larger amounts of sponge-layer diffusion may
388 !< be less stable.
389
390 real :: d2_bg_k2 = 2. !< Strength of second-order diffusion in the second sponge
391 !< layer from the model top. This value must be specified, and
392 !< should be less than 'd2_bg_k1'.
393
394 real :: d2_divg_max_k1 = 0.15 !< d2_divg max value (k=1)
395 real :: d2_divg_max_k2 = 0.08 !< d2_divg max value (k=2)
396 real :: damp_k_k1 = 0.2 !< damp_k value (k=1)
397 real :: damp_k_k2 = 0.12 !< damp_k value (k=2)
398
399 !> Additional (after the fact) terrain filter (to further smooth the terrain after cold start)
400 integer :: n_zs_filter = 0 !< Number of times to apply a diffusive filter to the topography
401 !< upon startup, if mountain is True and the model is not being
402 !< cold-started. This is applied every time the model is warm-started,
403 !< so if you want to smooth the topography make sure this is set to 0 after
404 !< the first simulation. If initializing the model from cold-start
405 !< the topography is already being filtered by an amount appropriate for
406 !< the model resolution. 0 by default.
407
408 integer :: nord_zs_filter = 4 !< Order of the topography filter applied to n_zs_filter.
409 !< Set to 2 to get a second-order filter, or 4 to get a fourth-order filter;
410 !< other values do no filtering. 0 by default. This should not be set to a
411 !< non-zero value on multiple successive simulations; the filter is applied
412 !< every time the model restarts. This option is useful for testing the
413 !< terrain filter, and SHOULD NOT BE USED FOR REGULAR RUNS.
414 !< use del-2 (2) OR del-4 (4)
415
416 logical :: full_zs_filter = .false. !< Whether to apply the on-line topography filter during
417 !< initialization. Only active if get_nggps_ic = .true. This is so
418 !< topography filtering can be performed on the initial conditions output by the
419 !< pre-processing tools, which currently do not support topography filter-
420 !< ing for some configurations (such as the nested grid); this also allows
421 !< the user to easily test changes to the topography filtering on the
422 !< simulation. Note that for all other initialization methods (if external_ic
423 !< = .true.) the on-line topography filter will be applied automatically
424 !< during the initialization of the topography. The default value is .false.
425
426 logical :: RF_fast = .false. !< Option controlling whether to apply Rayleigh damping (for tau > 0)
427 !< on the dynamic/acoustic timestep rather than on the physics timestep.
428 !< This can help stabilize the model by applying the damping more weakly
429 !< more frequently, so the instantaneous amount of damping (and thereby
430 !< heat added) is reduced. The default is .false., which applies the Rayleigh
431 !< drag every physics timestep.
432
433 logical :: consv_am = .false. !< Whether to enable Angular momentum fixer. The default is .false.
434
435
436 logical :: do_sat_adj= .false. !
437 logical :: do_f3d = .false. !
438 logical :: no_dycore = .false. !< Disables execution of the dynamical core, only running
439 !< the initialization, diagnostic, and I/O routines, and
440 !< any physics that may be enabled. Essentially turns the
441 !< model into a column physics model. The default is .false.
442
443 logical :: convert_ke = .false. !< If .true., adds energy dissipated through mechanical
444 !< damping to heat throughout the entire depth of the domain;
445 !< if .false. (default) this is only done in the sponge layer
446 !< at the top of the domain. This option is only enabled if
447 !< d_con > 1.e-5.
448
449 logical :: do_vort_damp = .false. !< Whether to apply flux damping (of strength governed by 'vtdm4')
450 !< to the fluxes of vorticity, air mass, and nonhydrostatic
451 !< vertical velocity (there is no dynamically correct way to add
452 !< explicit diffusion to the tracer fluxes). The form is the same
453 !< as is used for the divergence damping, including the same order
454 !< (from 'nord') damping, unless 'nord' = 0, in which case this
455 !< damping is fourth-order, or if 'nord' = 3,in which case this
456 !< damping is sixth-order (instead of eighth-order). We recommend
457 !< enabling this damping when the linear or non-monotonic
458 !< horizontal advection schemes are enabled, but is unnecessary and
459 !< not recommended when using monotonic advection. The default is .false.
460
461 logical :: use_old_omega = .true.
462 ! PG off centering:
463 real :: beta = 0.0 !< Parameter specifying fraction of time-off-centering for backwards
464 !< evaluation of the pressure gradient force. The default is 0.0, which
465 !< produces a fully backwards evaluation of the pressure gradient force
466 !< that is entirely evaluated using the updated (time n+1) dynamical fields.
467 !< A value of 0.5 will equally weight the PGF determined at times n and
468 !< n+1, but may not be stable; values larger than 0.45 are not recommended.
469 !< A value of 0.4 is recommended for most hydrostatic simulations, which
470 !< allows an improved representation of inertia-gravity waves in the tropics.
471 !< In non-hydrostatic simulations using the semi-implicit solver (a_imp > 0.5)
472 !< the values of 'a_imp' and 'beta' should add to 1, so that the time-centering is
473 !< consistent between the PGF and the nonhydrostatic solver.
474 !< The proper range is 0 to 0.45.
475
476 #ifdef SW_DYNAMICS
477 integer :: n_sponge = 0 !< Controls the number of layers at the upper boundary on
478 !< which the 2Dx filter is applied. This does not control the sponge layer.
479 !< The default value is 0.
480
481 real :: d_ext = 0. !< Coefficient for external (barotropic) mode damping. The
482 !< default value is 0.02. The proper range is 0 to 0.02. A value
483 !< of 0.01 or 0.02 may help improve the models maximum stable
484 !< time step in low-resolution (2-degree or lower) simulations;
485 !< otherwise a value of 0 is recommended.
486
487 integer :: nwat = 0 !< Number of water species to be included in condensate and
488 !< water vapor loading. The masses of the first nwat tracer species will be
489 !< added to the dry air mass, so that p is the mass of dry air, water vapor,
490 !< and the included condensate species. The value used depends on the
491 !< microphysics in the physics package you are using. For GFS physics
492 !< with only a single condensate species, set to 2. For schemes with
493 !< prognostic cloud water and cloud ice, such as GFDL AM2/AM3/AM4
494 !< Rotsteyn-Klein or Morrison-Gettlean microphysics, set to 3. For
495 !< warm-rain (Kessler) microphysics set to 4 (with an inactive ice tracer),
496 !< which only handles three species but uses 4 to avoid interference with the
497 !< R-K physics. For schemes such as WSM5 or Ferrier that have prognostic rain
498 !< and snow but not hail, set to 5 (not yet implemented). For six-category
499 !< schemes that also have prognostic hail or graupel, such as the GFDL, Thompson,
500 !< or WSM6 microphysics, set to 6. A value of 0 turns off condensate loading.
501 !< The default value is 3.
502
503 logical :: warm_start = .false. !< Whether to start from restart files, instead of cold-starting
504 !< the model. True by default; if this is set to .true. and restart
505 !< files cannot be found the model will stop.
506
507 logical :: inline_q = .true. !< Whether to compute tracer transport in-line with the rest
508 !< of the dynamics instead of sub-cycling, so that tracer transport is done
509 !< at the same time and on the same time step as is p and potential
510 !< temperature. False by default; if true, q_split and z_tracer are ignored.
511
512 logical :: adiabatic = .true. !< Whether to skip any physics. If true, the physics is not
513 !< called at all and there is no virtual temperature effect.
514 !< False by default; this option has no effect if not running solo_core.
515 #else
516 integer :: n_sponge = 1 !< Controls the number of layers at the upper boundary on which the 2Dx filter
517 !< is applied. This does not control the sponge layer. The default value is 0.
518
519 real :: d_ext = 0.02 !< Coefficient for external (barotropic) mode damping. Proper range is 0 to 0.02.
520 !< A value of 0.01 or 0.02 may help improve the models maximum stable time
521 !< step in low-resolution (2-degree or lower) simulations; otherwise a
522 !< value of 0 is recommended. The default value is 0.02.
523
524 integer :: nwat = 3 !< Number of water species to be included in condensate and
525 !< water vapor loading. The masses of the first nwat tracer species will be
526 !< added to the dry air mass, so that p is the mass of dry air, water vapor,
527 !< and the included condensate species. The value used depends on the
528 !< microphysics in the physics package you are using. For GFS physics
529 !< with only a single condensate species, set to 2. For schemes with
530 !< prognostic cloud water and cloud ice, such as GFDL AM2/AM3/AM4
531 !< Rotsteyn-Klein or Morrison-Gettlean microphysics, set to 3. For
532 !< warm-rain (Kessler) microphysics set to 4 (with an inactive ice tracer),
533 !< which only handles three species but uses 4 to avoid interference with the
534 !< R-K physics. For schemes such as WSM5 or Ferrier that have prognostic rain
535 !< and snow but not hail, set to 5 (not yet implemented). For six-category
536 !< schemes that also have prognostic hail or graupel, such as the GFDL, Thompson,
537 !< or WSM6 microphysics, set to 6. A value of 0 turns off condensate loading.
538 !< The default value is 3.
539
540 logical :: warm_start = .true. !< Whether to start from restart files, instead of cold-starting
541 !< the model. True by default; if this is set to .true. and restart
542 !< files cannot be found the model will stop.
543
544 logical :: inline_q = .false. !< Whether to compute tracer transport in-line with the rest
545 !< of the dynamics instead of sub-cycling, so that tracer transport is done
546 !< at the same time and on the same time step as is p and potential
547 !< temperature. False by default; if true, q_split and z_tracer are ignored.
548 logical :: adiabatic = .false. !< Run without physics (full or idealized).
549 #endif
550 !-----------------------------------------------------------
551 ! Grid shifting, rotation, and the Schmidt transformation:
552 !-----------------------------------------------------------
553 real :: shift_fac = 18. !< Westward zonal rotation (or shift) of cubed-sphere grid from
554 !< its natural orientation with cube face centers at 0, 90, 180, and 270
555 !< degrees longitude. The shift, in degrees, is 180/shift_fac. This shift
556 !< does not move the poles. By default this is set to 18, shifting the grid
557 !< westward 180/18=10 degrees, so that the edges of the cube do not run
558 !< through the mountains of Japan; all standard CM2.x, AM3, CM3, and
559 !< HiRAM simulations use this orientation of the grid.
560 !< Requires do_schmidt = .false.
561
562 ! Defaults for Schmidt transformation:
563 logical :: do_schmidt = .false. !< Whether to enable grid stretching and rotation using
564 !< stretch_fac, target_lat, and target_lon.
565 !< The default value is .false.
566 real(kind=R_GRID) :: stretch_fac = 1. !< Stretching factor for the Schmidt transformation. This
567 !< is the factor by which tile 6 of the cubed sphere will
568 !< be shrunk, with the grid size shrinking accordingly.
569 !< The default value is 1, which performs no grid stretching.
570 !< Requires do_schmidt =.true.
571 !< THE MODEL WILL CRASH IF stretch_fac IS SET TO ZERO.
572 !< Values of up to 40 have been found useful and stable
573 !< for short-term cloud-scale integrations.
574
575 real(kind=R_GRID) :: target_lat = -90. !< Latitude (in degrees) to which the center of tile 6 will be
576 !< rotated; if stretching is done with stretch_fac the center of
577 !< the high-resolution part of the grid will be at this latitude.
578 !< -90 by default, which does no grid rotation (the Schmidt transformation
579 !< rotates the south pole to the appropriate target).
580 !< Requires do_schmidt = .true.
581
582 real(kind=R_GRID) :: target_lon = 0. !< Longitude to which the center of tile 6 will be rotated.
583 !< 0 by default. Requires do_schmidt = .true.
584
585 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
586 ! Example #1a: US regional climate simulation, center located over Oklahoma city: (262.4, 35.4)
587 ! stretching factor: 2.5
588 ! Example #1b: US Hurricane model, center over Miami: (279.7, 25.8)
589 ! stretching factor: 3-5
590 ! Example #2a: South-East Asia Regional Climate H*** (SERACH), Central Taiwan: (121.0, 23.5)
591 ! Example #2b: Typhoon Model: (124.0, 22.0)
592 ! stretching factor: 5-10
593 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
594
595 logical :: reset_eta = .false.
596 real :: p_fac = 0.05 !< Safety factor for minimum nonhydrostatic pressures, which
597 !< will be limited so the full pressure is no less than p_fac
598 !< times the hydrostatic pressure. This is only of concern in mid-top
599 !< or high-top models with very low pressures near the model top, and
600 !< has no effect in most simulations. The pressure limiting activates
601 !< only when model is in danger of blowup due to unphysical negative
602 !< total pressures. Only used if 'hydrostatic' = .false.and the
603 !< semi-implicit solver is used. The proper range is 0 to 0.25.
604 !< The default value is 0.05.
605
606 real :: a_imp = 0.75 !< Controls behavior of the non-hydrostatic solver. Values > 0.5
607 !< enable the semi-implicit solver, in which the value of 'a_imp'
608 !< controls the time-off-centering: use a_imp = 1.0 for a fully
609 !< backward time stepping. For consistency, the sum of 'beta' and
610 !< 'a_imp' should be 1 when the semi-implicit solver is used. The
611 !< semi-implicit algorithm is substantially more efficient except
612 !< at very high (km-scale) resolutions with an acoustic time step
613 !< of a few seconds or less. Proper values are 0, or between 0.5
614 !< and 1. The default value is 0.75. Only used if
615 !< 'hydrostatic' = .false.
616
617 integer :: n_split = 0 !< The number of small dynamics (acoustic) time steps between
618 !< vertical remapping. 0 by default, in which case the model
619 !< produces a good first guess by examining the resolution,
620 !< dt_atmos, and k_split.
621
622 real :: fac_n_spl = 1.0 !< factor multiplying n_split up tp forecast hour fhouri
623 real :: fhouri = 0.0 !< forecast hour up to which the number of small dynamics (acoustic) time steps
624 !< are nint(n_split*fac_n_spl)
625
626 integer :: m_split = 0 !< Number of time splits for Riemann solver
627 integer :: k_split = 1 !< Number of vertical remappings per dt_atmos (physics timestep).
628 !< 1 by default.
629
630 logical :: use_logp = .false. !< Enables a variant of the Lin pressure-gradient force
631 !< algorithm, which uses the logarithm of pressure instead
632 !< of the Exner function (as in \cite lin1997explicit). This yields
633 !< more accurate results for regions that are nearly isothermal.
634 !< Ignored if 'hydrostatic' = .true. The default is .false.
635
636 ! For doubly periodic domain with sim_phys
637 ! 5km 150 20 (7.5 s) 2
638 !
639 ! Estimates for Gnomonic grids:
640 !===================================================
641 ! dx (km) dt (sc) n_split m_split
642 !===================================================
643 ! C1000: ~10 150 16 3
644 ! C2000: ~5 90 18 (5 s) 2
645 !===================================================
646 ! The nonhydrostatic algorithm is described in Lin 2006, QJ, (submitted)
647 ! C2000 should easily scale to at least 6 * 100 * 100 = 60,000 CPUs
648 ! For a 1024 system: try 6 x 13 * 13 = 1014 CPUs
649
650 integer :: q_split = 0 !< number of time steps for sub-cycled tracer advection.
651 !< The default value is 0 (recommended), in which case
652 !< the model determines the number of time steps from the
653 !< global maximum wind speed at each call to the tracer advection.
654
655 integer :: print_freq = 0 !< number of hours between print out of max/min and
656 !< air/tracer mass diagnostics to standard output. 0 by default, which
657 !< never prints out any output; set to -1 to see output after every
658 !< dt_at-mos. Computing these diagnostics requires some computational overhead
659
660 logical :: write_3d_diags = .true. !< whether to write out three-dimensional dynamical diagnostic
661 !< fields (those defined in fv_diagnostics.F90). This is useful
662 !< for runs with multiple grids if you only want very large 3D
663 !< diagnostics written out for (say) a nested grid, and not for
664 !< the global grid. False by default.
665 !------------------------------------------
666 ! Model Domain parameters
667 !------------------------------------------
668 integer :: npx !< Number of grid corners in the x-direction on one tile of the domain;
669 !< so one more than the number of grid cells across a tile. On the cubed sphere
670 !< this is one more than the number of cells across a cube face. Must be set.
671
672 integer :: npy !< Number of grid corners in the y-direction on one tile of the
673 !< domain. This value should be identical to npx on a cubed-sphere grid;
674 !< doubly periodic or nested grids do not have this restriction. Must be set.
675
676 integer :: npz !< Number of vertical levels. Each choice of npz comes with a
677 !< pre-defined set of hybrid sigma-pressure levels and model top
678 !< (see fv_eta.F90). Must be set.
679
680 integer :: npz_rst = 0 !< If using a restart file with a different number of vertical
681 !< levels, set npz_rst to be the number of levels in your restart file.
682 !< The model will then remap the restart file data to the vertical coordinates
683 !< specified by npz. 0 by default; if 0 or equal to npz no remapping is done.
684
685 integer :: ncnst = 0 !< Number of tracer species advected by fv_tracer in the dynamical core.
686 !< Typically this is set automatically by reading in values from field_table,
687 !< but ncnst can be set to a smaller value so only the first ncnst tracers
688 !< listed in field_table are not advected. 0 by default, which will use the value
689 !< from field_table.
690
691 integer :: pnats = 0 !< The number of tracers not to advect by the dynamical core.
692 !< Unlike dnats, these tracers are not seen by the dynamical core.
693 !< The last pnats entries in field_table are not advected.
694 !< The default value is 0.
695
696 integer :: dnats = 0 !< The number of tracers which are not to be advected by the dynamical core,
697 !< but still passed into the dynamical core; the last dnats+pnats tracers
698 !< in field_table are not advected. 0 by default.
699
700 integer :: ntiles = 1 !< Number of tiles on the domain. For the cubed sphere, this
701 !< should be 6, one tile for each face of the cubed sphere; normally for
702 !< most other domains (including nested grids) this should be set to 1.
703 !< Must be set.
704
705 integer :: ndims = 2 ! Lat-Lon Dims for Grid in Radians
706 integer :: nf_omega = 1 !< Number of times to apply second-order smoothing to the
707 !< diagnosed omega. When 0 the filter is disabled. 1 by default.
708
709 integer :: fv_sg_adj = -1 !< Timescale (in seconds) at which to remove two-delta-z
710 !< instability when the local (between two adjacent levels)
711 !< Richardson number is less than 1. This is achieved by local
712 !< mixing, which conserves mass, momentum, and total energy.
713 !< Values of 0 or smaller disable this feature. If n_sponge < 0
714 !< then the mixing is applied only to the top n_sponge layers of the
715 !< domain. Set to -1 (inactive) by default. The proper range is 0 to 3600.
716
717 integer :: na_init = 0 !< Number of forward-backward dynamics steps used to initialize
718 !< adiabatic solver. This is useful for spinning up the nonhydrostatic
719 !< state from the hydrostatic GFS analyses. 0 by default. Recommended
720 !< to set this to a non-zero value (1 or 2 is typically sufficient)
721 !< when initializing from GFS or ECMWF analyses.
722
723
724 logical :: nudge_dz = .false. !< During the adiabatic initialization (na_init > 0), if set
725 !< to .true., delz is nudged back to the value specified in the initial
726 !< conditions, instead of nudging the temperature back to the initial value.
727 !< Nudging delz is simpler (faster), doesn't require consideration of the
728 !< virtual temperature effect, and may be more stable. .false.by default.
729
730 real :: p_ref = 1.E5 !< Surface pressure used to construct a horizontally-uniform reference
731 !< vertical pressure profile, used in some simple physics packages
732 !< in the solo_core and in the Rayleigh damping. This should not be
733 !< confused with the actual, horizontally-varying pressure levels used
734 !< for all other dynamical calculations. The default value is 1.e5.
735 !< CHANGING THIS VALUE IS STRONGLY DISCOURAGED.
736
737 real :: dry_mass = 98290. !< If adjust_dry_mass is .true., sets the global dry air mass,
738 !< measured in the globally-averaged surface pressure (Pascals) by adding
739 !< or removing mass from the lowest layer of the atmosphere as needed.
740 !< The default value is 98290. (Pa).
741
742 integer :: nt_prog = 0
743 integer :: nt_phys = 0
744 real :: tau_h2o = 0. !< Time-scale (days) for simple methane chemistry to act as
745 !< a source of water in the stratosphere. Can be useful if the
746 !< stratosphere dries out too quickly; consider a value between
747 !< 60 and 120 days if this is the case. The default value is 0.,
748 !< which disables the methane chemistry. Values less than zero apply
749 !< the chemistry above 100 mb; else applied above 30 mb.
750 !< Requires 'adiabatic' to be .false.
751
752
753 real :: delt_max = 1. !< Maximum allowed magnitude of the dissipative heating rate, K s-1;
754 !< larger magnitudes are clipped to this amount. This can help avoid
755 !< instability that can occur due to strong heating when d_con > 0.
756 !< A value of 0.008 (a rate equivalent to about 800 K/day) is
757 !< sufficient to stabilize the model at 3-km resolution.
758 !< Set to 1. by default, which effectively disables this limitation.
759
760 real :: d_con = 0. !< Fraction of kinetic energy lost to explicit damping to be
761 !< converted to heat. Acts as a dissipative heating mechanism in
762 !< the dynamical core. The default is 0. Proper range is 0 to 1.
763 !< Note that this is a local, physically correct, energy fixer.
764
765 real :: ke_bg = 0. !< background KE production (m^2/s^3) over a small step
766 !< Use this to conserve total energy if consv_te=0
767
768 real :: consv_te = 0. !< Fraction of total energy lost during the adiabatic integration
769 !< between calls of the physics, to be added back globally as heat;
770 !< essentially the strength of the energy fixer in the physics.
771 !< Note that this is a global energy fixer and cannot add back energy
772 !< locally. The default algorithm increments the potential temperature
773 !< so the pressure gradients are unchanged. The default value is 0.
774 !< Proper range is 0 to 1. 1 will restore the energy completely to its
775 !< original value before entering the physics; a value of 0.7 roughly
776 !< causes the energy fixer to compensate for the amount of energy changed
777 !< by the physics in GFDL HiRAM or AM3.
778
779 real :: tau = 0. !< Time scale (in days) for Rayleigh friction applied to horizontal
780 !< and vertical winds; lost kinetic energy is converted to heat, except
781 !< on nested grids. The default value is 0.0, which disables damping.
782 !< Larger values yield less damping. For models with tops at 1 mb or lower
783 !< values between 10 and 30 are useful for preventing overly-strong polar night
784 !< jets; for higher-top hydrostatic models values between 5 and 15 should be
785 !< considered; and for non-hydrostatic models values of 10 or less should be
786 !< considered, with smaller values for higher-resolution.
787
788 real :: rf_cutoff = 30.E2 !< Pressure below which no Rayleigh damping is applied if tau > 0.
789
790 logical :: filter_phys = .false.
791 logical :: dwind_2d = .false. !< Whether to use a simpler & faster algorithm for interpolating
792 !< the A-grid (cell-centered) wind tendencies computed from the physics
793 !< to the D-grid. Typically, the A-grid wind tendencies are first
794 !< converted in 3D cartesian coordinates and then interpolated before
795 !< converting back to 2D local coordinates. When this option enabled,
796 !< a much simpler but less accurate 2D interpolation is used. False by
797 !< default.
798
799 logical :: breed_vortex_inline = .false. !< Whether to bogus tropical cyclones into the model,
800 !< which are specified by an external file. Options are set in
801 !< fv_nwp_nudge_nml. False by default.
802
803 logical :: range_warn = .false. !< Checks whether the values of the prognostic variables
804 !< are within a reasonable range at the end of a dynamics time
805 !< step, and prints a warning if not. The default is .false.;
806 !< adds computational, overhead so we only recommend using
807 !< this when debugging.
808
809 logical :: fill = .false. !< Fills in negative tracer values by taking positive tracers from
810 !< the cells above and below. This option is useful when the physical
811 !< parameterizations produced negatives. The default is .false.
812 logical :: fill_dp = .false. !< Like 'fill' except for p, the hydrostatic pressure thickness.
813 !< When the filling occurs a diagnostic message is printed out,
814 !< which is helpful for diagnosing where the problem may be occurring.
815 !< Typically, a crash is inevitable if the pressure filling is needed;
816 !< thus, this option is often better for debugging than as a safety valve.
817 !< The default is .false.
818

820 logical :: fill_wz = .false.
821 logical :: check_negative = .false. !< Whether to print the most negative global value of microphysical tracers.
822 logical :: non_ortho = .true.
823 logical :: moist_phys = .true. !< Run with moist physics
824 logical :: do_Held_Suarez = .false. !< Whether to use Held-Suarez forcing. Requires adiabatic
825 !< to be false. The default is .false.; this option has no
826 !< effect if not running solo_core.
827 logical :: do_reed_physics = .false.
828 logical :: reed_cond_only = .false.
829 logical :: reproduce_sum = .true. !< uses an exactly-reproducible global sum operation performed
830 !< when computing the global energy for consv_te. This is used
831 !< because the FMS routine mpp_sum() is not bit-wise reproducible
832 !< due to its handling of floating-point arithmetic, and so can
833 !< return different answers for (say) different processor layouts.
834 !< The default is .true.
835
836 logical :: adjust_dry_mass = .false. !< Whether to adjust the global dry-air mass to the
837 !< value set by dry_mass. This is only done in an initialization step,
838 !< particularly when using an initial condition from an external dataset,
839 !< interpolated from another resolution (either horizontal or vertical), or
840 !< when changing the topography, so that the global mass of the atmosphere
841 !< matches some estimate of observed value. False by default. It
842 !< is recommended to only set this to .true. when initializing the model.
843
844 logical :: fv_debug = .false. !< Whether to turn on additional diagnostics in fv_dynamics.
845 !< The default is .false.
846 logical :: disable_fv_restart_write = .false. !< Whether to disable saving fv_* restart files during a run.
847 !< The default is .false.
848 logical :: srf_init = .false.
849 logical :: mountain = .true. !< Takes topography into account when initializing the
850 !< model. Set this to .true. to apply the terrain filter (if n_zs_filter = 2
851 !< or 4) upon startup; also set to True when cold starting so that the
852 !< topography can be initialized. Only set this to .false. if you wish to
853 !< cold-start without any topography; this value is ignored for the aquaplanet
854 !< test_case = 14. The default is .true. It is highly recommended TO NOT ALTER
855 !< this value unless you know what you are doing.
856 logical :: old_divg_damp = .false. !< parameter to revert damping parameters back to values
857 !< defined in a previous revision
858 !< old_values:
859 !< d2_bg_k1 = 6. d2_bg_k2 = 4.
860 !< d2_divg_max_k1 = 0.02 d2_divg_max_k2 = 0.01
861 !< damp_k_k1 = 0. damp_k_k2 = 0.
862 !< current_values:
863 !< d2_bg_k1 = 4. d2_bg_k2 = 2.
864 !< d2_divg_max_k1 = 0.15 d2_divg_max_k2 = 0.08
865 !< damp_k_k1 = 0.2 damp_k_k2 = 0.12
866
867 logical :: remap_t = .true. !< Whether the vertical remapping is performed on (virtual) temperature
868 !< instead of (virtual) potential temperature. Since typically potential
869 !< temperature increases exponentially from layer to layer near the top
870 !< boundary, the cubic-spline interpolation in the vertical remapping
871 !< will have difficulty with the exponential profile. Temperature
872 !< does not have this problem and will often yield a more accurate result.
873 !< The default is .true.
874
875 logical :: z_tracer = .false. !< Whether to transport sub-cycled tracers layer-by-layer,
876 !< each with its own computed sub-cycling time step (if q_split = 0).
877 !< This may improve efficiency for very large numbers of tracers.
878 !< The default value is .false.; currently not implemented.
879
880 logical :: fv_land = .false. !< Whether to create terrain deviation and land fraction for
881 !< output to mg_drag restart files, for use in mg_drag and in the land
882 !< model. The default is .false; .true. is recommended when, and only
883 !< when, initializing the model, since the mg_drag files created provide a
884 !< much more accurate terrain representation for the mountain gravity
885 !< wave drag parameterization and for the land surface roughness than
886 !< either computes internally. This has no effect on the representation of
887 !< the terrain in the dynamics.

930 logical :: external_eta = .false. !< If .true., reads the interface coefficients ak and bk

935 logical :: read_increment = .false. !< read in analysis increment and add to restart
936 ! following are namelist parameters for Stochastic Energy Baskscatter dissipation estimate
937 logical :: do_skeb = .false. !< save dissipation estimate
938 integer :: skeb_npass = 11 !< Filter dissipation estimate "skeb_npass" times
939 ! Default restart files from the "Memphis" latlon FV core:
940 character(len=128) :: res_latlon_dynamics = 'INPUT/fv_rst.res.nc' !< If external_ic =.true.gives the filename of the
941 !< input IC file. The default is 'INPUT/fv_rst.res.nc'.
942 character(len=128) :: res_latlon_tracers = 'INPUT/atmos_tracers.res.nc' !< If external_ic =.true.and both ncep_ic and fv_diag_ic

944 !< initial conditions for the tracers, assumed to be a
945 !< legacy lat-lon FV core restart file.
946 !< The default is 'INPUT/atmos_tracers.res.nc'.
947 ! The user also needs to copy the "cold start" cubed sphere restart files (fv_core.res.tile1-6)
948 ! to the INPUT dir during runtime
949 !------------------------------------------------
950 ! Parameters related to non-hydrostatic dynamics:
951 !------------------------------------------------
952 logical :: hydrostatic = .true. !< Whether to use the hydrostatic or nonhydrostatic solver.
953 !< The default is .true.
954
955 logical :: phys_hydrostatic = .true. !< Option to enable hydrostatic application of heating from the physics
956 !< in a nonhydrostatic simulation: heating is applied in hydrostatic
957 !< balance, causing the entire atmospheric column to expand instantaneously.
958 !< If .false., heating from the physics is applied simply as a temperature
959 !< tendency. The default value is .true.; ignored if hydrostatic = .true.
960
961 logical :: use_hydro_pressure = .false. !< Whether to compute hydrostatic pressure for input to the physics.
962 !< Currently only enabled for the fvGFS model.
963 !< Ignored in hydrostatic simulations. The default is .false.
964
965 logical :: do_uni_zfull = .false. !< Whether to compute z_full (the height of each modellayer,
966 !< as opposed to z_half, the height of each model interface)
967 !< as the midpoint of the layer, as is done for the nonhydrostatic
968 !< solver, instead of the height of the location where p = p the mean
969 !< pressure in the layer. This option is not available for fvGFS or
970 !< the solo_core. The default is .false.
971
972 logical :: hybrid_z = .false. !< Whether to use a hybrid-height coordinate, instead of
973 !< the usual sigma-p coordinate. The default value is .false.
974 !< (Not currently maintained.)
975
976 logical :: Make_NH = .false. !< Whether to re-initialize the nonhydrostatic state, by recomputing
977 !< dz from hydrostatic balance and setting w to 0. The default is
978 !< false.
979
980 logical :: make_hybrid_z = .false. !< Converts the vertical coordinate to a hybrid-height coordinate,
981 !< instead of the usual sigma-p coordinate. Requires hybrid_z = .true.
982 !< The default value is .false.
983
984 logical :: nudge_qv = .false. !< During the adiabatic initialization (na_init > 0), if set to .true.,
985 !< the water vapor profile is nudged to an analytic fit to the
986 !< HALOE climatology. This is to improve the water vapor concentrations
987 !< in GFS initial conditions, especially in the stratosphere, where
988 !< values can be several times higher than observed. This nudging is
989 !< unnecessary for other ICs, especially the ECMWF initial conditions.
990 !< The default is .false.
991
992 real :: add_noise = -1. !< Amplitude of random thermal noise (in K) to add upon startup.
993 !< Useful for perturbing initial conditions. -1 by default;
994 !< disabled if 0 or negative.
995
996 integer :: a2b_ord = 4 !< Order of interpolation used by the pressure gradient force
997 !< to interpolate cell-centered (A-grid) values to the grid corners.
998 !< The default value is 4 (recommended), which uses fourth-order
999 !< interpolation; otherwise second-order interpolation is used.
1000
1001 integer :: c2l_ord = 4 !< Order of interpolation from the solvers native D-grid winds
1002 !< to latitude-longitude A-grid winds, which are used as input to
1003 !< the physics routines and for writing to history files.
1004 !< The default value is 4 (recommended); fourth-order interpolation
1005 !< is used unless c2l_ord = 2.
1006
1007
1008 real(kind=R_GRID) :: dx_const = 1000. !< Specifies the (uniform) grid-cell-width in the x-direction
1009 !< on a doubly-periodic grid (grid_type = 4) in meters.
1010 !< The default value is 1000.
1011
1012 real(kind=R_GRID) :: dy_const = 1000. !< Specifies the (uniform) grid-cell-width in the y-direction
1013 !< on a doubly-periodic grid (grid_type = 4) in meters.
1014 !< The default value is 1000.
1015
1016 real(kind=R_GRID) :: deglat = 15. !< Latitude (in degrees) used to compute the uniform f-plane
1017 !< Coriolis parameter for doubly-periodic simulations
1018 !< (grid_type = 4). The default value is 15.
1019
1020 !The following deglat_*, deglon_* options are not used.
1021 real(kind=R_GRID) :: deglon_start = -30., deglon_stop = 30., & !< boundaries of latlon patch
1022 deglat_start = -30., deglat_stop = 30.
1023
1024 logical :: regional = .false. !< Default setting for the regional domain.
1025
1026 integer :: bc_update_interval = 3 !< Default setting for interval (hours) between external regional BC data files.
1027
1028 !>Convenience pointers
1029 integer, pointer :: grid_number
1030
1031 !f1p
1032 logical :: adj_mass_vmr = .false. !TER: This is to reproduce answers for verona patch. This default can be changed
1033 ! to .true. in the next city release if desired

1035 logical :: write_optional_dgrid_vel_rst = .false. ! Whether to write out optional D-grid winds when restart_from_agrid_winds is active
1036 !integer, pointer :: test_case

1274 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
1275 ! Five prognostic state variables for the f-v dynamics
1276 !-----------------------------------------------------------------------
1277 ! dyn_state:
1278 ! D-grid prognostatic variables: u, v, and delp (and other scalars)
1279 !
1280 ! o--------u(i,j+1)----------o
1281 ! | | |
1282 ! | | |
1283 ! v(i,j)------scalar(i,j)----v(i+1,j)
1284 ! | | |
1285 ! | | |
1286 ! o--------u(i,j)------------o
1287 !
1288 ! The C grid component is "diagnostic" in that it is predicted every time step
1289 ! from the D grid variables.

1295 real, _ALLOCATABLE :: qdiag(:,:,:,:) _NULL !< diagnostic tracers
